intro: Adenostyles rhombifolia, commonly known as the rhombic bellflower, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It is characterized by its rhombic-shaped leaves and showy, bell-like flowers that range in color from white to pink. The plant typically grows in dry, rocky habitats and is adapted to arid environments. It belongs to the Campanulaceae family and is known for its ornamental value in gardens. Its structure includes a basal rosette of leaves with upright flowering stems.
